task.title: Centering Text
task.shortdesc: You can use CSS to center a block of text in HTML5. Headings, paragraphs, and quotes are often centered for emphasis or design purposes.

prereq.p: In order to center an item, you must have a functioning HTML document with a matching CSS style sheet.
Next, pick out which text you would like to center.

taskbody.context: To center your selected item of text:

step.cmd: Locate the CSS that agrees with your item of text.
step.stepxmp: For example, h1 {, p {, and so on.

step.cmd: Create a new line for the CSS element.
Type text-align: in the new line.
Set the value of the text-align property to center.

substep.cmd: Do this by typing Center after the colon.
substep.stepxmp: It will look like: p { text-align: center;
substep.note: Don’t forget to add the semicolon after the center attribute, or the property might not display correctly.

step.cmd: Check to see if your CSS updates are effective.
step.info: Saving your HTML/CSS as a .html document will allow you to view it as a webpage and see your changes to the CSS as they would appear to the public.
